subject: Re: [junit] Javascript errors using Jwebunit.
msgSnippet: jWebUnit sits on top of HttpUnit which has only limited support for JavaScript. You may want to consider turning off JavaScript and limiting your tests to ones
messageBody:
jWebUnit sits on top of HttpUnit which has only limited support for
JavaScript. You may want to consider turning off JavaScript and
limiting your tests to ones that don't require it or perhaps try
HtmlUnit (better JavaScript support) or WebTest (declarative
XML/Ant-based tests which sits on top of HtmlUnit).

Paul.


amit wrote:

>

> menu_def();
>
> displaymenu();failed:org.mozilla.javascript.EvaluatorException:The
> undefined value has no properties.
>
> The code of the JSP page is as follows:
> <head>
> ....
> ...
> <script language="Javascript1.2" src="menulib.js">
> </script>
> </head>
> <script language="Javascript1.2">
> function menu_def{
> ....
> ....
> ....
> }
> </script>
> <script language="Javascript1.2">
> menu_def();
> displayMenu();
> </script>
>
> Is this the problem using Jwebunit for javascript or somthing else?
> Could anyone please explain me what the problem is.
>
> Thanking you,
> Amit
